issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
We ran into this issue on v2. Allocation does not happen in the specified amount of time.

Error Message
expected:<2> but was:<0>
Stacktrace
java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<2> but was:<0>
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:743)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:118)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:555)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:542)
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.client.api.impl.TestAMRMClient.testAMRMClientMatchStorage(TestAMRMClient.java:495)

comments.body: Uploading patch. I changed the behavior, so that we test with both fair and capacity schedulers. I also made sure that we explicitly call the updates and heartbeats, so that we do not rely on timing issues.

This message was automatically generated.
The unit test failure is an unrelated one, YARN-5548.

Thanks for the patch [~miklos.szegedi@cloudera.com]! Took a cursory look at the patch.
1) In places where sleep() is replaced with waitForNMHeartbeat(), we may want to update the comments as well since " sleep to let NM's heartbeat to RM and trigger allocations" no longer makes sense.
2) At line 1015, the code is check container status from NMs, so it does not need to wait for NM heartbeats to RM.
3) bq. // Wait for fair scheduler update thread
   We are synchronously calling update() in the test thread, not waiting for the update thread.  so maybe we can say triggering fair scheduler update?
Thank you, [~haibochen] for the review. I updated the patch.
Thanks for the update, [~miklos.szegedi@cloudera.com]. One nit, the sleep(100) right after nmClient.getContainerStatus() is now  changed to sleep(10). We should probably leave it as is.

Thanks for working on this. [~miklos.szegedi@cloudera.com]. The patches looks good generally. Some nits:
# Would triggerSchedulingWithNMHeartBeat() or triggerAllocationWithNMHeartBeat() be better names for waitForNMHeartbeat()? And we can get grid of comments before each time we invoke waitForNMHeartbeat() in that case.
# Would be better to use setup() and teardown() instead of startApp() and cancelApp()? Since these functions do more than just start an app and cancel an app.
Thank you, [~yufeigu] for the comments, I updated the patch.
